Key Match Events: Alex Verdugo hit a tiebreaking single in the seventh inning
Alex Verdugo made a sliding catch on Michael Massey’s fourth-inning fly just inside the line to strand two runners
Jazz Chisholm Jr. singled leading off and stole second on a play allowed to stand following a video review
Verdugo’s hit scored Jazz Chisholm Jr.
Clay Holmes worked 1 2/3 scoreless innings for the win
Luke Weaver got four straight outs for the save in his postseason debut
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees started Alex Verdugo over rookie Jasson Domínguez in left field due to defense
Verdugo was in a 3-for-25 skid at the plate and was booed by fans
Boone felt it was important to lean on his guys in the clubhouse for support
Verdugo made a sliding catch that prevented the Royals from taking a bigger lead
Gleyber Torres put the Yankees ahead 2-1 in the third with a 339-foot home run just over the right-field short porch
Bobby Witt Jr. was 0 for 5 in the game
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge went 0 for 4 with three strikeouts
Bobby Witt Jr. barked at plate umpire Adam Hamari after a called third strike in the ninth
Juan Soto went 3 for 5 and threw out Salvador Perez in the second inning trying to score from second on Melendez’s single to right
Yuli Gurriel threw out runners at the plate on grounders in the first and fifth innings
Miscellaneous Highlights: Four Yankees relievers combined to allow only an unearned run over four innings after ace Gerrit Cole came out
Michael Wacha gave up three runs, four hits and three walks in four-plus innings
Carlos Rodón (16-9, 3.96 ERA) starts Game 2 in the best-of-five series against the Royals’ Cole Ragans (11-9, 3.14)
